author: jih2nn
content:
I agree that aggregating ILs is not straightforward. You can't have validators to sign a shared data in one round when there are multiple IL proposers. If we aggregate ILs in append-only way rather than map-reduce fashion, it would increase complexity and require more data size.

This is just an idea but what if:
1) a block proposer in slot N aggregate ILs and pass it to IL committee in slot N + 1
2) IL committee in slot N + 1 signs the IL_agg and a block proposer in slot N + 1 aggregates signatures
3) a builder in slot N + 1 is constrained by the IL_agg

author: jih2nn
content:
Not aggregating IL could be an option, but is there a slashing or penalty mechanism for IL committee? How do we know if an attester didn't receive enough ILs to validate a payload or pretend they didn't?

Also, even if we go without reward for the time being, I think the design should be forward compatible.

author: jih2nn
content:
You can have IL committee sign the same data, which is a list of summary, so that it can be aggregated by it. This would be the expected outcome:

aggregation_bits: BitVec[IL_COMMITTEE_SIZE]
inclusion_summaries: List[Summary, MAX_TX_PER_IL]
signature: BLSSignature

author: jih2nn
content: It's to mitigate the issue that we can't aggregate signatures if they're signed on different data. In case we want to put something onchain for reward or what not.
